benchmark_details.name: RedPajama: an Open Dataset for Training Large Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: The RedPajama datasets, which include RedPajama-V1 and RedPajama-V2, consist of over 100 trillion tokens and address data-related challenges in the development of open-source language models, providing transparency and mechanisms for dataset curation and analysis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide training data for large language models and foster research in dataset curation and analysis.

data.source: Common Crawl, Wikipedia, Books, arXiv, Stack Exchange
data.annotation: Various quality signals measured for web data

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of models trained on the RedPajama datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher quality signals correlate with better model performance across tasks.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures included ablation studies showcasing the impact of quality signals.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: ODC-By-1.0 and licenses that may apply to constituent parts.
